alert.note: Alert for Carlton, South St. Louis; Southern Lake, North Shore (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 5:41AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern St. Louis and southwestern Lake Counties through 615 AM CDT... At 541 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near City of Rice Lake, to near Wisconsin Point, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... French River and Island Lake around 550 AM CDT. Stoney Point and Knife River around 555 AM CDT. Larsmont around 600 AM CDT. Two Harbors around 605 AM CDT. Castle Danger, Brimson, Thomas Lake Near Brimson and Highland Lake around 615 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Wild Rice Lake, Fredenberg, Wales, Lakewood Twp, Palmers, Congdon Park, Lakeside-Lester Park, North Shore, Pequaywan Lake and Alger. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive through flood waters. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Carlton, South St. Louis; Southern Lake, North Shore
